metadata.title: CVE-2019-11675 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The groonga-httpd package 6.1.5-1 for Debian sets the /var/log/groongaownership to the groonga account, which might let local users obtain rootaccess because of unsafe interaction with logrotate. For example, anattacker can exploit a race condition to insert a symlink from/var/log/groonga/httpd to /etc/bash_completion.d. NOTE: this is an issue inthe Debian packaging of the Groonga HTTP server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

groonga - 9.0.1-2
groonga-bin - 9.0.1-2
groonga-examples - 9.0.1-2
groonga-httpd - 9.0.1-2
groonga-munin-plugins - 9.0.1-2
groonga-plugin-suggest - 9.0.1-2
groonga-server-common - 9.0.1-2
groonga-server-gqtp - 9.0.1-2
groonga-token-filter-stem - 9.0.1-2
groonga-tokenizer-mecab - 9.0.1-2
libgroonga0 - 9.0.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: groonga package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-2').
